intro: Conophytum tetracarpum, commonly known as the four-armed conophytum, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, fleshy, and often ornate leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves. Conophytum tetracarpum is prized for its unique appearance and is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a decorative plant.
